com.here.android.mpa.mapping

Class MapRoute

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.android.mpa.common.ViewObject
      • com.here.android.mpa.mapping.MapObject
        • com.here.android.mpa.mapping.MapRoute

  • public final class MapRoute
extends MapObject
    Represents a Route that can be displayed on a Map.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MapRoute

        public MapRoute()
        Creates a MapRoute object.

      • MapRoute

        public MapRoute(Route route)
        Creates a MapRoute with a specified Route.

        Typically, a MapRoute is created after a Route has been calculated. An application can pass a calculated Route as a parameter to this method instead of making an explicit call to MapRoute.setRoute(Route). Adding the new MapRoute object to a Map can be done by way of the Map.addMapObject(MapObject) method.

        Parameters:
        route - A calculated Route used to set to the MapRoute

    • Method Detail

      • isManeuverNumberVisible

        public boolean isManeuverNumberVisible()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether maneuver numbers are displayed along with this route.
        Returns:
        True if maneuver numbers are displayed with the route, false otherwise

      • setManeuverNumberVisible

        public MapRoute setManeuverNumberVisible(boolean visible)
        Sets maneuver numbers to be either displayed along with this route or not displayed. By default, maneuver number is invisible.
        Parameters:
        visible - A boolean specifying whether maneuver numbers are displayed
        Returns:
        The updated MapRoute itself.

      • getColor

        public int getColor()
        Returns the current ARGB (Alpha/Red/Green/Blue) integer color value used to display this route.

        If MapRoute.RenderType is set to MapRoute.RenderType.USER_DEFINED getting this property will return the value you set. If MapRoute.RenderType is not MapRoute.RenderType.USER_DEFINED getting this property will return 0 if the MapRoute has not been added to a map. After being added to the map it will return the pre-defined value for the current map scheme.

        Note: Alpha-value transparency is supported.

        Returns:
        The current ARGB integer color value. The packed integer is made up of 4 bytes: alpha, red, green, blue. Each color component has a value range from [0..255], with 0 meaning no contribution for that component and 255 meaning 100% contribution
        See Also:
        android.graphics.Color

      • setColor

        public MapRoute setColor(int argbColor)
        Sets a color for displaying the route, using an ARGB (Alpha/Red/Green/Blue) integer color value.

        Setting this property will change the color of the MapRoute and change the RenderType to MapRoute.RenderType.USER_DEFINED. Calling MapRoute.setRenderType(MapRoute.RenderType) other than MapRoute.RenderType.USER_DEFINED will reset any color previously set by using this method.

        Note: Alpha-value transparency is supported.

        Parameters:
        argbColor - The ARGB integer color value. The packed integer is made up of 4 bytes: alpha, red, green, blue. Each color component has a value range from [0..255], with 0 meaning no contribution for that component and 255 meaning 100% contribution.
        Returns:
        The updated MapRoute itself.
        See Also:
        android.graphics.Color

      • getTraveledColor

        public int getTraveledColor()
        Returns the current ARGB (Alpha/Red/Green/Blue) integer color value used to display the traveled route.

        If MapRoute.RenderType is set to MapRoute.RenderType.USER_DEFINED getting this property will return the value you set. If MapRoute.RenderType is not MapRoute.RenderType.USER_DEFINED getting this property will return 0 if the MapRoute has not been added to a map. After being added to the map it will return the pre-defined value for the current map scheme.

        Note: Alpha-value transparency is supported.

        Returns:
        The current ARGB integer color value. The packed integer is made up of 4 bytes: alpha, red, green, blue. Each color component has a value range from [0..255], with 0 meaning no contribution for that component and 255 meaning 100% contribution.
        See Also:
        android.graphics.Color

      • setTraveledColor

        public MapRoute setTraveledColor(int argbColor)
        Sets a color for displaying the traveled route, using an ARGB (Alpha/Red/Green/Blue) integer color value.

        Setting this property will change the traveled color of the MapRoute and change the RenderType to MapRoute.RenderType.USER_DEFINED. Calling MapRoute.setRenderType(MapRoute.RenderType) other than MapRoute.RenderType.USER_DEFINED will reset any color previously set by using this method.

        MapRoute.setTraveledColor(int) is not supported by Transit and UrbanMobility routes.

        Note: Alpha-value transparency is supported.

        Parameters:
        argbColor - The ARGB integer color value. The packed integer is made up of 4 bytes: alpha, red, green, blue. Each color component has a value range from [0..255], with 0 meaning no contribution for that component and 255 meaning 100% contribution.
        Returns:
        The updated MapRoute itself.
        See Also:
        android.graphics.Color

      • getUpcomingColor

        public int getUpcomingColor()
        Returns the current ARGB (Alpha/Red/Green/Blue) integer color value used to display the upcoming route.

        Upcoming is the part of the route from next waypoint to final destination. If MapRoute.RenderType is set to MapRoute.RenderType.USER_DEFINED getting this property will return the value you set. If MapRoute.RenderType is not MapRoute.RenderType.USER_DEFINED getting this property will return 0 if the MapRoute has not been added to a map. After being added to the map it will return the pre-defined value for the current map scheme.

        Note: Alpha-value transparency is supported.

        Returns:
        The current ARGB integer color value. The packed integer is made up of 4 bytes: alpha, red, green, blue. Each color component has a value range from [0..255], with 0 meaning no contribution for that component and 255 meaning 100% contribution.
        See Also:
        android.graphics.Color

      • setUpcomingColor

        public MapRoute setUpcomingColor(int argbColor)
        Sets a color for displaying the upcoming route, using an ARGB (Alpha/Red/Green/Blue) integer color value.

        Setting this property will change the upcoming color of the MapRoute and change the RenderType to MapRoute.RenderType.USER_DEFINED. Calling MapRoute.setRenderType(MapRoute.RenderType) other than MapRoute.RenderType.USER_DEFINED will reset any color previously set by using this method.

        MapRoute.setUpcomingColor(int) is not supported by Transit and UrbanMobility routes.

        Note: Alpha-value transparency is supported.

        Parameters:
        argbColor - The ARGB integer color value. The packed integer is made up of 4 bytes: alpha, red, green, blue. Each color component has a value range from [0..255], with 0 meaning no contribution for that component and 255 meaning 100% contribution.
        Returns:
        The updated MapRoute itself.
        See Also:
        android.graphics.Color

      • getOutlineColor

        public int getOutlineColor()
        Returns the current ARGB (Alpha/Red/Green/Blue) integer color value used to display the outline route. If MapRoute.RenderType is set to MapRoute.RenderType.USER_DEFINED getting this property will return the value you set, otherwise 0.

        Note: Alpha-value transparency is supported.

        Returns:
        The current ARGB integer color value. The packed integer is made up of 4 bytes: alpha, red, green, blue. Each color component has a value range from [0..255], with 0 meaning no contribution for that component and 255 meaning 100% contribution.
        See Also:
        android.graphics.Color

      • setOutlineColor

        public MapRoute setOutlineColor(int argbColor)
        Sets a color for displaying the route outline, using an ARGB (Alpha/Red/Green/Blue) integer color value. Outline is rendered as a solid line, which is wider than the route line. Hence, transparent route colors will be blended with the underlying outline color. Setting this property will change the outline color of the MapRoute and change the MapRoute.RenderType to MapRoute.RenderType.USER_DEFINED. Calling MapRoute.setRenderType(MapRoute.RenderType) other than MapRoute.RenderType.USER_DEFINED will reset any color previously set by using this method. The outline color will be applied to upcoming and traveled portions of a route. MapRoute.setOutlineColor(int) is not supported by Transit and UrbanMobility routes.

        Note: Alpha-value transparency is supported.

        Parameters:
        argbColor - The ARGB integer color value. The packed integer is made up of 4 bytes: alpha, red, green, blue. Each color component has a value range from [0..255], with 0 meaning no contribution for that component and 255 meaning 100% contribution.
        Returns:
        The updated MapRoute itself.
        See Also:
        android.graphics.Color

      • getTextColor

        public int getTextColor()
        Returns the current ARGB (Alpha/Red/Green/Blue) integer color value used to define the text on the route. If MapRoute.RenderType is set to MapRoute.RenderType.USER_DEFINED getting this property will return the value you set, otherwise 0.

        Note: Alpha-value transparency is supported.

        Returns:
        The current ARGB integer color value. The packed integer is made up of 4 bytes: alpha, red, green, blue. Each color component has a value range from [0..255], with 0 meaning no contribution for that component and 255 meaning 100% contribution.
        See Also:
        android.graphics.Color

      • setTextColor

        public MapRoute setTextColor(int argbColor)
        Sets a color for displaying text on route, using an ARGB (Alpha/Red/Green/Blue) integer color value. Setting this property will change the text color on the MapRoute and change the MapRoute.RenderType to MapRoute.RenderType.USER_DEFINED. Calling MapRoute.setRenderType(MapRoute.RenderType) other than MapRoute.RenderType.USER_DEFINED will reset any color previously set by using this method. The text color will be applied to upcoming and traveled portions of a route. MapRoute.setTextColor(int) is not supported by Transit and UrbanMobility routes.

        Note: Alpha-value transparency is supported.

        Parameters:
        argbColor - The ARGB integer color value. The packed integer is made up of 4 bytes: alpha, red, green, blue. Each color component has a value range from [0..255], with 0 meaning no contribution for that component and 255 meaning 100% contribution.
        Returns:
        The updated MapRoute itself.
        See Also:
        android.graphics.Color

      • setTextOutlineColor

        public MapRoute setTextOutlineColor(int argbColor)
        Sets a color for displaying text outline on the route, using an ARGB (Alpha/Red/Green/Blue) integer color value. Setting this property will change the text outline color of the MapRoute and change the MapRoute.RenderType to MapRoute.RenderType.USER_DEFINED. Calling MapRoute.setRenderType(MapRoute.RenderType) other than MapRoute.RenderType.USER_DEFINED will reset any color previously set by using this method. The text outline color will be applied to upcoming and traveled portions of a route. MapRoute.setTextOutlineColor(int) is not supported by Transit and UrbanMobility routes.

        Note: Alpha-value transparency is supported.

        Parameters:
        argbColor - The ARGB integer color value. The packed integer is made up of 4 bytes: alpha, red, green, blue. Each color component has a value range from [0..255], with 0 meaning no contribution for that component and 255 meaning 100% contribution.
        Returns:
        The updated MapRoute itself.
        See Also:
        android.graphics.Color

      • getTextOutlineColor

        public int getTextOutlineColor()
        Returns the current ARGB (Alpha/Red/Green/Blue) integer color value used to display the text outline on the route. If MapRoute.RenderType is set to MapRoute.RenderType.USER_DEFINED getting this property will return the value you set, otherwise 0.

        Note: Alpha-value transparency is supported.

        Returns:
        The current ARGB integer color value. The packed integer is made up of 4 bytes: alpha, red, green, blue. Each color component has a value range from [0..255], with 0 meaning no contribution for that component and 255 meaning 100% contribution.
        See Also:
        android.graphics.Color

      • getManeuverNumberColor

        public int getManeuverNumberColor()
        Returns the current ARGB (Alpha/Red/Green/Blue) integer color value used to display the maneuver number. If MapRoute.RenderType is set to MapRoute.RenderType.USER_DEFINED getting this property will return the value you set.

        Note: Alpha-value transparency is supported.

        Returns:
        The current ARGB integer color value. The packed integer is made up of 4 bytes: alpha, red, green, blue. Each color component has a value range from [0..255], with 0 meaning no contribution for that component and 255 meaning 100% contribution.
        See Also:
        android.graphics.Color

      • setManeuverNumberColor

        public MapRoute setManeuverNumberColor(int argbColor)
        Sets a color for displaying the maneuver number color, using an ARGB (Alpha/Red/Green/Blue) integer color value. Maneuver number color is rendered only if MapRoute.isManeuverNumberVisible() returns true. Setting this property will change the maneuver number color of the MapRoute and border of its square. MapRoute.RenderType will be changed to MapRoute.RenderType.USER_DEFINED. Calling MapRoute.setRenderType(MapRoute.RenderType) other than MapRoute.RenderType.USER_DEFINED will reset any color previously set by using this method. MapRoute.setManeuverNumberColor(int) is not supported by Transit and UrbanMobility routes.

        Note: Alpha-value transparency is supported.

        Parameters:
        argbColor - The ARGB integer color value. The packed integer is made up of 4 bytes: alpha, red, green, blue. Each color component has a value range from [0..255], with 0 meaning no contribution for that component and 255 meaning 100% contribution.
        Returns:
        The updated MapRoute itself.
        See Also:
        android.graphics.Color

      • getRoute

        public Route getRoute()
        Returns the Route that has been displayed on the Map.
        Returns:
        The Route

      • setRoute

        public MapRoute setRoute(Route route)
        Sets a Route that will be displayed on the Map.
        Parameters:
        route - A Route representing the route to be displayed on the Map.
        Returns:
        The updated MapRoute itself.

      • setRenderType

        public MapRoute setRenderType(MapRoute.RenderType type)
        Sets the RenderType associated with this MapRoute.

        Note: setting MapRoute.setColor(int) or MapRoute.setTraveledColor(int) or MapRoute.setUpcomingColor(int) or MapRoute.setOutlineColor(int) or MapRoute.setManeuverNumberColor(int) will reset MapRoute.RenderType to MapRoute.RenderType.USER_DEFINED. Default value is MapRoute.RenderType.PRIMARY.

        Note: MapRoute must be added to a Map before calling this method. Otherwise, its value will not be changed.

        Parameters:
        type - The RenderType to be used.
        Returns:
        The updated MapRoute itself.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if type is invalid.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if MapRoute is not added to Map.

      • getRenderType

        public MapRoute.RenderType getRenderType()
        Returns the RenderType associated with this MapRoute.

        Default value is MapRoute.RenderType.PRIMARY.

        Returns:
        The RenderType associated with the MapRoute.

      • setTrafficEnabled

        public MapRoute setTrafficEnabled(boolean enable)
        Enable display of traffic on this MapRoute. By default traffic on route is disabled.

        Note: Truck routes and public transport timetable routes are unsupported.

        Parameters:
        enable - True will display traffic if MapTrafficLayer.RenderLayer.ONROUTE and Map.setTrafficInfoVisible(boolean) have been enabled. False will hide traffic on route rendering for this route.
        Returns:
        The updated MapRoute itself.

      • isTrafficEnabled

        public boolean isTrafficEnabled()
        Checks if traffic is enabled for this route.
        Returns:
        True if traffic is enabled for this MapRoute, false otherwise.
